intro: Arachnites biancae, commonly known as the white-spotted nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Arachnites biancae is notable for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitats.
